intro: Tradescantia rufa, commonly known as red wandering Jew, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and green foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Tradescantia rufa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant leaves and easy care requirements.
